subject: Critical Thinking
title: The Loaded Question: Trapped Before You Answer
description: One-minute skill: The Loaded Question: Trapped Before You Answer.

hook.text: 'Have you stopped cheating on exams?' Whether you answer yes or no, you've admitted to cheating.

buildup.text: A loaded question contains a hidden assumption. Answering it accepts the assumption, even if it's false.

discovery.text: Lawyers, journalists, and debaters use loaded questions to corner opponents into admissions they didn't intend.

twist.text: The correct response isn't yes or no â€” it's rejecting the premise: 'I reject the assumption in your question.'

climax.text: Most survey questions are subtly loaded. 'Do you support the wasteful government spending plan?' presumes it's wasteful.

punchline.text: Before answering a question, check what answering it admits.

quiz.question: What makes a question 'loaded'?
options: It contains a hidden assumption that any answer would accept
